results.title: Goori goori dreaming (A)
results.brief_description: Goori Goori Dreaming is a glimpse into the culture, traditions and spirit of Australia. Woven through the film are the contemporary paintings of Gunaminy Vanessa Fisher, as she teaches her family about the earth and their heritage.

results.title: Goofy's freeway troubles (K)
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Productions, Ken Peterson and Les Clark
results.brief_description: In this amusing driver education animation, Goofy demonstrates some common freeway problems that can be avoided by following a simple checklist which includes the car, the driver, the freeway and basic common sense.

results.title: Goods traffic for Europe
results.brief_description: Every day some 15,000 goods trains transport their freights to and from the national and international markets contributing to the supply of thousands of European towns. In addition 14,000 passenger trains travel 600,000 miles daily carrying approximately 44 million people.

results.title: Goods & chattels : the story of Theodor
results.creator_credit: Robert Voigt, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Robert Voigt recounts his rich family history and their connection to their farm in Beechworth. When his father, Henry, purchased more land, he received, as part of the goods and chattels in the contract, Theodor, a farm labourer. Theodor was a man of vast intelligence and mysterious origins.

results.title: Goodnight Mister Tom
results.brief_description: During the London blitz widower Tom Oakley (John Thaw) is one of many residents of a close knit community asked to do their bit for the war effort by billeting children from war torn London. Thus, shy, young and awkward William Beech (Nick Robinson) finds himself living with “Mister” Tom. Initially apprehensive because he doesn’t know much about children - a thought echoed by the rest of the parish who think he’s a grumpy old man, a touching relationship develops between the two. Through Tom’s care William learns to read and write, makes friends, discovers he has an artistic talent, and is treated with love and kindness for the first time - gaining confidence never possible with his abusive mother. When William returns home Mister Tom realises how much he has grow to care for the boy and sets out to rescue him, begging the question, “Why is he so fond of the boy”, and could love have developed between the cantankerous widow and his surrogate son? Based on the popular children’s novel by Michelle Margorian, “Goodnight Mister Tom” is a testament to the strength of humanity and the belief that, regardless of age, people have fundamental human experiences such as grief, suffering and hope that they can share and learn from. Cast also includes Annabelle Apsion, John Cater and Geoffrey Hutchings.

results.title: Goodness gracious me [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: British Broadcasting Corporation, Anil Gupta, Nick Wood and Gareth Carrivick
results.brief_description: This video presents a selection of the best from the first series of the hilarious British television comedy program “Goodness gracious me”, an Anglo-Asian show featuring irreverent and satirical sketches and songs, in quite a pointed way, about multicultural society and western values and traditions. Meet the Kapoor (pronounced Cooper) family, Indian but more English than the English, Smita Smitten - the showbiz kitten, the Techno-Bangra Kiss My-Chuddie-Boys, and many other wonderful characters who don’t mind having a “go” at their own culture, be it Anglo or Asian. In fact nothing is sacred. Also features a short segment of bloopers at the end. Cast includes Sanjeev Bhaskar, Meera Syal, Kulvinder Ghir, Nina Wadia, David Lamb, Amanda Holden, Anil Desai, Arabella Weir.

results.title: Goodness - it's milk!
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture. Film Unit
results.brief_description:
This short film, produced by the Victorian Department of Agriculture, promotes the dairy industry by proclaiming the benefits of drinking milk.

The film opens with some lovely footage of a couple exploring the Blue Dandenongs, including a milkbar with signs for ‘Peter’s Ice-Cream’, ‘Herald’, and ‘Four ‘n’ Twenty Pies’, where they order two tall glasses of milk.

The film then shows scenes of schoolchildren, a patient and nurse in a hospital and a domestic kitchen, while the narrator describes the health benefits of milk. The film finishes with footage of the dairy industry, from the farm to industrial pasteurising and bottling processes, and finally home delivery.
